---
title: "For iOS Developers"
---

import { Steps } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

This guide will walk you through the process of setting up **Libra2Kit**, and
fetching data on the Libra2 blockchain.

<Steps>
  1. Install the SDK

     **Libra2Kit** is available as a Swift package. To add it to your project,
     add the following to your `Package.swift` file:

     ```swift filename="Package.swift"
     dependencies: [
       .package(url: "https://github.com/mcxross/swift-libra2.git", .upToNextMajor(from: <version>))
     ]
     ```

  2. Import the SDK

     Import the SDK in your Swift file:

     ```swift filename="Main.swift"
     import Libra2Kit
     ```

  3. Create the ClientConfig object

     This object is used to configure the client behavior. You can set `maxRetries`,
     `requestTimeout`, and `retryOnServerErrors` properties.

     ```swift filename="Main.swift"
     let config = ClientConfig(
         followRedirects: true,
         agent: "Libra2Client",
         likeAgent: nil,
         requestTimeout: 5000,
         retryOnServerErrors: 3,
         maxRetries: 5,
         cache: false,
         proxy: nil
     )
     ```

  4. Create the Libra2Settings object

     This object is used to configure the Libra2 network connection. You can set `network`,
     `fullnode`, and `faucet` properties.

     ```swift filename="Main.swift"
     let libra2Settings = Libra2Settings(
         network: .devnet,
         fullNode: nil,
         faucet: nil,
         indexer: nil,
         client: nil,
         clientConfig: config,
         fullNodeConfig: nil,
         indexerConfig: nil,
         faucetConfig: nil
     )
     ```

  5. Create the Libra2Config object

     ```swift filename="Main.swift"
     let libra2Config = Libra2Config(settings: libra2Settings)
     ```

  6. Create the Libra2 object

     This object is used to interact with the Libra2 blockchain. It serves as the
     entry point for all interactions with the blockchain.

     ```swift filename="Main.swift"
     let libra2 = Libra2(config: libra2Config, graceFull: false)
     ```

  7. Fetch the chain ID

     ```swift filename="Main.swift"
     let chainId = try await libra2.getChainId()
     ```

     Congratulations! You have successfully set up the **Libra2Kit** SDK and fetched the chain ID from the Libra2 blockchain.
</Steps>

## Complete Example

```swift filename="Main.swift"

import SwiftUI
import Libra2Kit

struct ContentView: View {
@State private var chainId: String? = nil

var body: some View {
  VStack {
    if let chainId = chainId {
      Text("Chain ID: \(chainId)")
    } else {
      Text("Fetching Chain ID...")
    }
  }
.padding()
    .onAppear {
    fetchChainId()
  }
}

private func fetchChainId() {
  DispatchQueue.main.async {
    Task {
      do {

        let clientConfig = ClientConfig(
            followRedirects: true,
            agent: "Libra2Client",
            likeAgent: nil,
            requestTimeout: 5000,
            retryOnServerErrors: 3,
            maxRetries: 5,
            cache: false,
            proxy: nil
        )

        let libra2Settings = Libra2Settings(
            network: .devnet,
            fullNode: nil,
            faucet: nil,
            indexer: nil,
            client: nil,
            clientConfig: clientConfig,
            fullNodeConfig: nil,
            indexerConfig: nil,
            faucetConfig: nil
        )

        let libra2Config = Libra2Config(settings: libra2Settings)
        let libra2 = Libra2(config: libra2Config, graceFull: false)

        let chainId = try await libra2.getChainId()
        self.chainId = chainId.expect(message: "Failed...")?.stringValue ?? "null"
      } catch {
        print("Failed to get chain ID: \(error)")
        self.chainId = "Error"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```
